node.title: The first rule of doing business in China? Don't get political. Women's tennis ripped up the rule book
node.alt: Tennis player Peng Shuai throws a tennis ball into the air
node.description: One sportsÂ organisation is standing up to the rising superpower and refusing to back down, and it's not clear authorities in Beijing know what to do next, writes Carrington Clarke.
node.content:
["For years, foreign businesses that wanted to reap the riches of the Chinese market have honoured one tradition \u2014 don't get political.\u00a0", "To draw the ire of the Chinese Communist Party was to hurt your own profits.\u00a0", "Everyone from the US National Basketball Association to the Arsenal Football Club has offended the Chinese government and paid a heavy price.\u00a0", "But one sports\u00a0organisation is standing up to the rising superpower and refusing to back down.\u00a0", "Women's Tennis Association (WTA) chief\u00a0Steve Simon is putting everything on the line to defend his star player.\u00a0", "And it's not clear if authorities in Beijing know what to do next.\u00a0", "
A long history of vanishing celebrities\u00a0
", "Until last month, tennis player Peng Shuai had\u00a0transcended sport in China and was a fully fledged celebrity.\u00a0", "But then she\u00a0posted serious sexual assault allegations against a senior member of China's political elite to social media site Weibo.", "\"Even if it is like an egg hitting a rock, or if I am like a moth drawn to the flame, inviting self-destruction, I will tell the truth about you,\" she said of her alleged abuser\u00a0Zhang Gaoli.", "Zhang has not responded to her allegations.", "Her post was scrubbed from China's\u00a0censored internet within\u00a020 minutes, and Peng swiftly disappeared.\u00a0", "She is\u00a0not the first Chinese celebrity to suddenly disappear\u00a0after falling afoul of the government.\u00a0", "", "
Actress Fan Bingbing vanished for four months in 2018 amid allegations of tax evasion.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Alastair Grant)
", "In 2018, China's highest-paid female star\u00a0Fan BingBing\u00a0vanished for months after she was accused of tax evasion.\u00a0", "And ubiquitous celebrity technology chief Jack Ma has rarely been seen in public since he\u00a0criticised Chinese regulators.\u00a0", "Peng's circumstances should be seen as the latest in a series of brutal crackdowns where no-one is invulnerable, according to John Delury, professor of Chinese Studies at Yonsei University.", "\"It's part of a pattern of an increasingly repressive atmosphere,\" he said.\u00a0", "What Peng has working in her favour \u2014\u00a0and what took Beijing by surprise \u2014\u00a0is that someone\u00a0sprang into action.", "
'Prove that Peng is free'
", "The WTA sounded the alarm as soon Peng appeared to retreat from public life and they were unable to contact her.\u00a0", "Beijing attempted to downplay Peng's disappearance\u00a0and released\u00a0an email purportedly written by the player to Steve Simon in which she retracted\u00a0her sexual assault allegations\u00a0and insisted\u00a0she was\u00a0\"resting at home and everything is fine\".\u00a0", "Unconvinced, Simon\u00a0threatened to pull the WTA's business from China unless the country could \"verifiably prove that Peng is free and able to speak without interference or intimidation\".\u00a0", "", "
WTA chief Steve Simon suspended\u00a0all tennis tournaments in China, including Hong Kong.\u00a0(AP:\u00a0Yong Teck Lim)
", "A video of Peng dining with friends and her coach was then released by Chinese state media, but something about it felt off for Simon.\u00a0", "Last week, he suspended all tennis tournaments in China, including Hong Kong.\u00a0", "It was a bold move\u00a0by the organisation.", "China currently hosts 11 WTA tournaments every year and Shenzhen was supposed to host the finals from 2022 until 2030.", "
Why the WTA did what the NBA could not
", "The WTA is by no means the first sporting organisation to be involved in a spat with the Chinese state, but it may be the first willing to actually take a costly stand.\u00a0", "The National Basketball Association (NBA) has had a series of altercations with China since\u00a0Houston Rockets general manager Daryl Morey tweeted \u2014 and then deleted \u2014 his\u00a0support for\u00a0pro-democracy protesters in Hong Kong in 2019.\u00a0", "The NBA issued a grovelling apology and legendary player\u00a0LeBron James slammed Morey as \"either misinformed or not really educated on the situation\".\u00a0", "Despite the backdown, China wasn't satisfied.", "China's state-run television broadcaster CCTV banned the NBA \u2014\u00a0a move\u00a0estimated to have cost the league around $US400 million ($557.8 billion).", "The WTA may have had no choice but to stand up to China, according to\u00a0Yun\u00a0Jiang, a senior research officer at the Australian National University.\u00a0", "\"China didn't disappear or arrest members of the NBA,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"It was about members of the NBA criticising China. But they are not Chinese people, so they're not under the jurisdiction of China anywhere.\"\u00a0", "The WTA, founded by Billie Jean King, was\u00a0structured to give a greater voice to female players and its current structure still reflects this.", "Of the eight-person board, three\u00a0positions are held by players.\u00a0", "
Is this a turning point?\u00a0
", "Despite China's attempts to censor Peng Shuai's allegations,\u00a0it's still generating heat both inside and outside the country.\u00a0", "\"It is still being talked about despite censorship. Some people are very good at avoiding censorship,\"\u00a0Yun\u00a0Jiang said.\u00a0", "\"There is still a lot of support for her as well\u00a0inside China.\"", "Part of the attention comes down to the power of Peng's celebrity, and part of it is the timing of her allegations.\u00a0\u00a0", "We are just three months out from the\u00a0Beijing Winter Olympics, and the United States, Australia and Lithuania have all announced a diplomatic boycott of the event, citing human rights abuses.", "China has repeated claimed that is \"against the politicisation of sport\" when queried about both the WTA suspension and the diplomatic boycott of the winter Olympics.\u00a0", "\"I think China does care,\" said Yun\u00a0Jiang.\u00a0", "\"It does care about its international reputation.\"\u00a0", "", "
Despite the WTA's tough stance, analysts doubt that China will back down.\u00a0(Reuters:\u00a0Susana Vera)
", "However, the current pressure is unlikely to change the outcome for a woman making serious claims of sexual abuse.\u00a0", "\"It is a positive message the [WTA are] sending, especially to\u00a0to\u00a0its members,\" said\u00a0Yun\u00a0Jiang said.", "\"I don't think the Chinese Government or the Chinese Communist Party is going to suddenly back down."]
